channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: All in the Family - Perl developer in Central Manchester
item.description: Family is great, but working with them can be a nightmare, am I right? Cousin Edward nipping out early, Aunt Phyllis getting into the sherry before closing time . . . But what if you could get close-knit clan vibes working with a large company that started out as a family business?

item.title: Superheroes Spotted in Canary Wharf! Perl Developer in London
item.description: Look there, up in the sky: Itâ€™s a birdâ€”itâ€™s a planeâ€”itâ€™s you, saving UK job hunters from disaster one click at a time! Could you be the next Captain Career Search or Wonder Worker? If youâ€™ve ever dreamed of donning the tights and mask, or even if you think you havenâ€™t got the legs for the tights but would like to make a difference to people all over the UK, then read on.

item.title: Youâ€™re Leaving, On a Jet Plane ... Perl in Houston
item.description: Whether youâ€™re in Portland or Poughkeepsie, Kansas City or Kalamazoo, our clientâ€™s relocation package means that Perl programmers from coast to coast are eligible for this role. Starting to feel a twinge of wanderlust?

item.title: DevOps Daredevil Ready for Double Black Diamond Adventure
item.description: Our client is looking for someone who can blend good DBA skills with the best of the DevOps philosophy. This king or queen of the mountain should know how schema management fits into a CI/CD process, but should also be able to explain it clearly to a junior dev fresh off the bunny hill because hey, werenâ€™t we all novices at one point?

item.title: A Perl Job thatâ€™s as Comfortable as Your Favourite Pair of Jeans
item.description: Our client is looking for a Perl programmer who prefers laid-back and low-key over flashy and dramatic. For a work-until-your-eyes-bleed Silicon Valley start up, look elsewhereâ€”this company is for chill folks who want to come in, do a great job, and sleep at home instead of on a cot at the office. Feeling inspired to pull up a chair and get settled? Then read on!

item.title: Barcelon Perl and Friends 2019
item.description: November 9, 2019 in Barcelona, Spain. A free one-day conference for Geeks and Friends

item.description: I see lots of cakes!

Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;

item.title: Raku gets its very own subreddit
2019.42 Question
item.description: The last edition of the Perl 6 weekly. Pointing to the new Rakudo Weekly. Welcome!

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 31: Illegal Division by Zero and Dynamic Variables
item.description: Laurent blog, as always, started with easy one-liners solution then expanded into full solution. Highly Recommended.

item.title: PERL WEEKLY CHALLENGE â€“ 031
item.description: First timer, Javier, came up with great blog showing his Perl and Raku coding skills.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 031
item.description: Another geat blog by Jaldhar.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 031: Division by Zero & Dynamic Variable Name
item.description: E. Choroba advised how eval is not ideal for catching exception in pre-Perl v5.14. Also shared the best solution.

item.title: Dynamic Zero with Raku
item.description: Arne explained how dynamic variable name is not a good idea and how you can still get it done in Raku, if you want.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 031
item.description: Adam took the challenge to another level by doing in C++. Please do checkout the blog for more details.

item.title: Meet The Champion - Kevin Colyer
item.description: Please check out the short interview with the "Perl Weekly Challenge - 030" winner Kevin Colyer.

item.title: RECAP - Perl Weekly Challenge - 031
item.description: Review of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 032
item.description: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: Announcing MooX::Press
item.description: MooX::Press is a quick way of building a bunch of Moo roles and classes in one use statement.

item.title: Cor - Background core Perl OO
item.description: Showing 'a perfectly non-sensical, Moose code (which nonetheless runs just fine)' that Cor will fix.

item.title: Paws the XV (Still Some Way to Go)
item.description: The most recent entry of the series by John.

item.title: Request for Feedback: Perl Documentation Site
item.description: A reimagined documentation site.

item.title: TPCiH 2020 - Newsletter #1
item.description: In 2020 The Perl Coference will be in Houston, Texas. Congratulations to the super-early announcement and newsletter!

item.title: #431 - The Perl 6 Weekly is dead. Long live the Rakudo Weekly!
item.description:
Hi,

The separation of the new space rocket from the mother station is progressing fine. The perl6.org site now welcomes the visitors to the The Raku Programming Language.

The Perl 6 Weekly newsletter was renamed to be "Rakudo Weekly". You can subscribe to it with your e-mail address to get notifications every time a new edition is published.

In the Perl world, I am glad to see the first announcement from The Perl Conference that will take place in Huston next summer. I am really glad with such an early announcemet.

Enjoy your week!
